content: 99.co Event Property Investments Asked by Kuriakin J. ZengAsked on 20 May 2019Will property in Singapore continue to rise in value? Or should I invest in other countries? What data should I look at? Any dataset available?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Douglas Chow, Chief Enlightenment Officer at Empower AdvisoryLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hi Zeng, Douglas here. 2nd keynote speaker.Yes property prices in general will continue to rise in Singapore but slower than before due to the cooling measures. Investing in other countries has its own unique set of risks so do all the necessary homework and don't get burnt like other folks before you.Propert investment in Singapore is easy because data is transparent and easily available but not always so for foreign countries, so u have to check with their respective property agents or agency where to access a centralised database.​​​
You can always connect with me via https://www.facebook.com/douglas.chow.908 or simply whatsapp/sms my company 24/7 hotline @83324283
Remember, plan your finances properly, don’t overstretch, do your homework and enjoy your property investment journey.
Regards
Douglas Chow1 comment2
Ang Yee Gary27 May 2019Any ball park figure on the expected growth in property price in next few years

Ang Yee Gary, Medicine at National University Of SingaporeLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 21 May 2019Property value is dependent on gdp growth and population growth
So the rise in singapore property is due to the above 2 factors
Choose a country with rapid gdp growth and population growth then it is very likely property price will rise rapidly.0 comments2
